We were staying close to Loria and decided to stop in on a rainy day.  The design is very nice, minimal, modern.  All of the dishes we had were pretty good: cockles, prawns in a lemongrass-cream sauce, bread y tomato w/ olive oil (very fresh), mushroom croquettes.  Also picked up a bottle of red wine to go (Protos Crianza 2009), recommended by our server, which was very good as well.  Prices were very reasonable (@30 euro for all the food + 2 cañas + a glass of cava + water, not including the bottle of wine to go).  All in all, a great lunch, would definitely recommend.
